Parody can indeed be used as a form of political commentary or social criticism. It often satirizes prominent issues, events, and people in modern society, highlighting their flaws and shortcomings in a humorous or exaggerated manner. Because it is meant to entertain as well as inform, it has the potential to reach a wide audience, even those who are not necessarily interested in politics or social issues.

Parodies can be effective tools for political commentary or social criticism because they can expose the hypocrisy, absurdity, and corruption inherent in political systems and social norms. They can also point out the failings of leaders or institutions by mocking their actions, beliefs, or values. In this way, parody can be insightful and a powerful way to call out those who wield power or influence.

However, it is important to note that parody can also be misused to spread misinformation or to perpetuate stereotypes, and it is essential to ensure that the target and message of the parody are clear and well-intentioned to avoid any unintentional harm.
